questions.text: What is the correct naming convention for Standard Operating Procedures?

options.explanation: SOPs follow the SOP-XXX naming convention as defined in Section 1.
POL-XXX is the naming convention for Policies.
WI-XXX is the naming convention for Work Instructions.
DOC-XXX is not a valid naming convention in the QMS.

questions.text: How are document changes submitted for review?

options.explanation: Changes are submitted via GitHub Pull Requests, not email.
Authors submit changes via GitHub Pull Requests as defined in the Review Process.
The QMS uses Git-based version control, not shared drives.
Direct production edits bypass the required review and approval process.

questions.text: What is the initial status of a newly created document?

options.explanation: New documents must go through review and approval before reaching approved status.
Per Section 1, initial status is set to 'draft'.
Documents start as draft before entering review.

questions.text: A document can be merged to the main branch before all approvers have signed off.
questions.explanation: Per the Approval Process, all reviewers must approve and approvers must sign off before the PR is merged.

questions.text: Who is responsible for maintaining the document control system?

options.explanation: Engineering creates content but does not maintain the document control system.
Per the Responsibilities section, Quality maintains the document control system.
Authors create and maintain document content, not the control system.
Reviewers verify technical accuracy, not maintain the system.
